strings used in build workout activity Build a New Workout Add a new Exercise to the Workout Save Workout New Workout Title:
Strings for Muscle Groups Shoulders Biceps Triceps Forearms Chest Back Abdominal Glutes Hamstrings Calves
Strings for Chest Exercises Barbell Bench Press The barbell bench press is an upper-body weight training exercise in which the person lays flat on their back on a weight training bench and pushes a barbell upwards towards the ceiling
Incline Bench Press The incline barbell bench press is a version of the traditional bench press in which the bench is positioned at about a 45 degree angle resulting in an inclined position
Decline Bench Press The decline bench press is another version of the traditional bench press in which the bench is set to a 15 to 30 degree decline, placing the body on a downward slope
Cable Fly A cable fly is performed on a machine with cable resistance usually in the standing position. One uses both sides of the machine, on cable in each hand. The user pushes both arms out in front of them and then while keeping arms slightly bent, slowly releases both arms at the same time back towards the machine. When getting to a point that is safe for the user, they will then pull these cables back to the original start position in front of them, simulating a flying movement
Dumbbell Bench Press The dumbbell bench press is an upper-body weight training exercise in which the person lays flat on their back on a weight training bench with a dumbbell in each hand and pushes the dumbbells upwards towards the ceiling
Decline Dumbbell Bench Press The decline dumbbell bench press is a version of the dumbbell bench press in which the bench is set to a 15 to 30 degree decline, placing the body on a downward slope
Incline Dumbbell Bench Press The incline dumbbell bench press is another version of the dumbbell bench press in which the bench is positioned at about a 45 degree angle resulting in an inclined position
Dumbbell Fly The dumbbell fly is a movement where the user uses two dumbbells and lies flat on their back on a bench holding the dumbbell directly in front of them. The user then lowers both dumbbells towards their side while keeping their arms slightly bent. After reaching a safe point, the user returns back to the start position and then repeats
Pushups The pushup is an exercise where a person lies facing the floor and, keeping their back straight, raises their body by pressing down on their hands, pushing themselves up from the ground
Strings for forearms
Barbell Holds The barbell hold is an exercise where the barbell is placed on a rack at hip level. The person then grabs the bar with hands just outside of thighs and lifts the bar off of the rack holding the bar up with arms hanging down in front of them
Hand Gripper The handgripper is a device that simulates a crushing movement. The person sets the resistance on the device in which they would like to use then grabs the device and closes their hand against the resistance
Plate Pinch A plate pinch is a movement a person does by grabbing a plate and picking it up using their fingers in a pinching motion and holding the plate off of the ground for a certain amount of time
Farmer Carries A farmers carry involves a person holding a weight, either dumbbell or kettlebell, in each hand and walking for a certain distance or time
Strings for Triceps
Dumbbell Tricep Extensions To do a dumbbell tricep extension the person will start in a standing or sitting position with dumbbells in each hand. The person raises the dumbbells above their head with arms extended out above. The dumbbells then slowly get lowered behind the head doing best to not let the elbows flare out. When the forearms move slightly past parallel to the floor, bring weight back to starting position
Dips To perform a dip, a person uses a dip attachment or the edge of a bench/chair. If using an attachment, the person will hold their body off of the ground and slowly lower themselves down and then after breaking the parallel point with their elbows, will push themselves back up into the starting position. If using a chair/bench the user will grip the bench/chair with their fingers point down towards the floor and elbows pointed behind them. The person will walk their feet out in front of them extending themselves out, slowly lower themselves down then pushing themselves back into the starting position
Seated Tricep Press Tp perform the seated tricep extension the person will take one dumbbell at a time and get in a seated position. the person will then put the dumbbell up on their shoulder, flaring their elbow out to the side. Once in position, the person will extend the dumbbell up to the ceiling while doing best to keep elbow in the same position and then lowering the dumbbell back into the starting position
Tricep Cable Pushdowns The machine tricep extension is used with a rope attachment on a cable machine. The person stands in front of the rope and grasps with both hands. The person then lowers arms down and locks both elbows down by their side. The rope is then pushed down extending both arms down towards the floor flaring at the bottom and then returning to starting position, keeping both elbows stuck to the side the entire time
Skull Crushers The skullcrusher is used commonly with a preacher curl bar. The person will use this bar and lay flat on their back extending their arms directly above them. While keeping their elbows pinched in, the person lowers the bar down close to the bridge of the nose, hence nose buster, and then pushes the arms back to the original extended position
Strings for Shoulders
Seated Overhead Weighted Press To perform this exercise, the person will start in a seated position with the bar racked to a similar height in front of them. They will grip the bar and place it on their front shoulders with hands slightly wider then their shoulders. The person will then press the bar over their head until the arms are fully extended and then lower the bar back to the front of the shoulders
Weighted Lateral Raises The lateral raise is performed with a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended down by the side. The person will then, while keeping the arms straight and body locked into place, use their shoulder muscles to pull the dumbbells up to the ceiling at a 45 degree angle from directly in front of them
Weighted Front Raises The front raise is similar to the lateral raise but except for the person raising the dumbbells at a 45 degree angle, the user lifts them directly in front of them using the front part of their shoulder to do so while keeping the body locked in place and keeping the arms locked out as well
Weighted Upright Rows To perform a weighted upright row, the person will load a barbell with a safe weight and lift the barbell from the ground while in a standing position. The arms will be completely straightened in front of the person. The person will then pull the weight straight up, keeping their elbows up the entire time and flared to the side. After pulling the weight straight up as high as the persons arms will let them, they will slowly lower the weight back into the start position
Arnold Press To do the arnold press, the person with start by standing with dumbbells in each hand, shoulder height, with elbows bent and palms facing the body. The person brings the elbows out wide to the side while rotating hands so the palms face forward and pressing the dumbbells over head until the arms are straight out. Pause at the top, and the reverse the movement to return to the start position
Weighted Rear Delt Raises The person will start belly down on an inclined bench. With dumbbells in each hand, the person will start with the dumbbells raised out in front of them with palms facing down and pull the arms backwards slightly past the persons side and then return back to the starting position
Standing Overhead Weighted Press The person will start in a standing position with the barbell on the shoulders and palms facing up. The person will then push the barbell over their heads fully extending their arms and then returning back to the starting position
Strings for Bicep Exercises Dumbbell Curls To perform a dumbbell curl, the person will grab a dumbbell in one or both hands and curl the weight up to their shoulder and then return to a fully extended position either to the side or front of the person
Machine Dumbbell Curls The person will go to a cable machine and attach a curl attachment of their choice. The machine height should be set close to the ground. When ready the person will stand in front of the machine grabbing the attachment with both hands and curl both arms at the same time to the users chest or shoulders and the return to the fully extended position
Incline Dumbbell Curls The incline dumbbell curls is a variation of the dumbbell curl in which the person is seated in an inclined weight bench, making the arms go further back than a normal curl and lengthening the movement
Sitting Preacher Curls The person will start in a seated position with a preacher curl bar gripped using both hands. They will then use both hands to curl the bar up to the chest/shoulder area and return back to the starting position with arms fully extended out
Strict Preacher Curls The strict preacher curl is a variation of the preacher curl in which the person will stand with their back against a wall with a preacher curl bar and will perform the curls in this position. The wall will force the person to only use their arms and will not be able to use their body to help curl the weight up making this work strictly on the arms
Strings for Back Exercises Barbell Deadlift To perform the barbell deadlift, the person will start with the barbell on the ground at their feet in a standing position. The person will then bend over, making sure to keep their back straight, and grab the bar lifting it up until they are standing straight up. After reaching the peak they will then return back to the starting position on the floor
Barbell Bent Over Row The person will begin in the deadlift position and raise the bar off of the ground slightly being sure to keep the back straight,. They will then pull the bar up to their chest with their arms while remaining in this bent over position and then extending the arms back to the starting position. The person will continue this series of movements to complete this exercise
Hex Bar Deadlift The hex bar deadlift is a variation of the barbell deadlift in which the person will use a hex bar deadlift setup to complete their exercise. The person will stand in the middle of the hex bar and grab both handles on each side of the bar using these to pull the bar up until the person is standing straight up
One Arm Dumbbell Row The one arm dumbbell row is a variation of the bent over row in which the person will graba dumbbell in one hand at a time and get in the bent over position and use their arm to pull the dumbbell up to their chest then return back to the starting position with the arm fully locked out. The person will repeat this same movement on their alternate arm as well
Pendlay Row The pendlay row is yet another version of the bent over row except the person will start with the barbell on the floor before each rep. After the rep is reached on the peak, the person will return the barbell back to the floor each time
Pull Ups The pull up is performed on any pull up bar. The person will grab a hold of the bar and lift their feet off of the ground. They will then pull themselves up until their chin reaches the height of the bar then lower themselves back down until their arms are completely locked out
Seated Cable Row The seated cable row is similar to the barbell row but the user is seated in a cable row machine. The person will grab the handle and pull to their chest and return back to a fully extended position with their arms creating a "rowing" motion with their body
T Bar Row The t bar row is a variation of the barbell row in which on end of the barbell is attached in a landmine setup with the t bar attachment being connected to the other side. The person will grab this t bar attachment with both hands and pull the attachment to their chest and then return back to the starting position with arms fully extended out
Strings for Abdominal Exercises Ab Crunch Machine Ab Crunch Machine
Air Bicycles Air Bicycles
Crunch Crunch
Flutter Kick Flutter Kick
Lying Leg Raise Lying Leg Raise
Plank Plank
Russian Twist Russian Twist
V Up V Up
Abdominal Rollout Abdominal Rollout
Strings for Glutes Exercises Barbbell Hip Thrust Barbbell Hip Thrust
Cable Kickback Cable Kickback
Glute Blaster Glute Blaster
Glute Bridge Glute Bridge
Machine Hip Abduction Machine Hip Abduction
Strings for Hamstring Exercises Standing Lunge Standing Lunge
Leg Curl Leg Curl
Romanian Deadlift Romanian Deadlift
Seated Leg Curl Seated Leg Curl
Elevated Deadlift Elevated Deadlift
Single Leg Hamstring Curl Single Leg Hamstring Curl
Strings for Calves Exercises Leg Press Calf Raise Leg Press Calf Raise
Donkey Calf Raise Donkey Calf Raise
Seated Calf Raise Seated Calf Raise
Smith Machine Calf Raise Smith Machine Calf Raise
Standing Barbbell Calf Raise Standing Barbbell Calf Raise
Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise
